page.title: 17CLUBS & ASSOCIATIONS
page.content: Bodle Street Green Village Hall is used on a weekly basis by the recently formed Play Group and for monthly meetings of the Women's Institute and the Gardening Club. In Ashburnham the sporting events seem endless with Keep Fit/Aerobics in the village hall and two Badminton Clubs who also use the Hall. You can join a mixed league or ladies Stool Ball team, play Sunday cricket and for the very sturdy, tug of war. Cubs are a thriving organisation but Guides and Scouts have recently disbanded through lack of support. A clay pigeon shooting club has recently been formed in Brown Bread Street for weekly shoots. Local rough pasture is used for motor cycle scrambling and trials.There are therefore a whole range of activities for every age group.
